You shake your head and stand your ground.The blue-furred Raka glares at you and stridesfrom the agon. He returns a few moments laterwith two other Rakas, each holding ropes and anet. "I won't be taken captive like some animal!"you shout. A Raka tries to rope you, but you duck out ofreach. They draw closer. Like a football quarter-back, you spin and dart past them. "Kela! Zaark!" the Rakas yell, but you're al-ready out of the agon, running across the dimly litland. Helped by the light gravity, you quickly reach agrove of cluster-leaf trees, and you keep running,on and on. At last you reach the open coun-tryside. In the soft reddish gray twilight you seethe Great River just ahead. You stop to rest besideits waters.
